line_1: The Fop of flow'rs, the MORE of a Parterre;
line_2: Who, once full-dress'd, fears from his place to stir,

line_1: Pours forth her beauties thro' the gay parterre;
line_2: With all the blushing fruits that crown the year.
" And hangs on wav'ring wings in air;

line_1: Imbrown thy Slope, and nod on thy Parterre,
line_2: Another Age shall see the golden Ear

line_1: Survey the opera as a gay parterre:
line_2: Fir'd by new passion you address the fair;
